Inherit

    +Self:SELF.parent_object:OBJECT

Public

    -Self:SELF.create:SELF
        Create

Public

    -Self:SELF.create_with :INTEGER :SELF
        Create and Set the cdrom given a drive

Public

    -Self:SELF.open :INTEGER
        Opens a CD-ROM drive for access. This newly opened CD-ROM becomes the default CD used. Drives are numbered starting with . Drive is the system default CD-ROM.

Public

    -Self:SELF.status:INTEGER
        This function returns the current status of the CD-ROM drive.

Public

    -Self:SELF.cd_indrive :INTEGER :BOOLEAN
        Given a status, returns if there's a disk in the drive

Public

    -Self:SELF.cd_play_tracks (:INTEGER,:INTEGER,:INTEGER,:INTEGER) :INTEGER
        Play the given CD starting at and for tracks and frames. If both and are 0, play until the end of the CD. This function will skip data tracks. This slot should only be called after calling the slot to get track information about the CD. This function returns 0, or -1 if there was an error.

Public

    -Self:SELF.cd_play :INTEGER length :INTEGER :BOOLEAN
        Play the given CD starting at frame for frames. It returns , or if there was an error.

Public

    -Self:SELF.cd_pause
        Set the CD-ROM to pause.

Public

    -Self:SELF.cd_resume
        Resume CD-ROM.

Public

    -Self:SELF.cd_stop
        Stop playing CD-ROM.

Public

    -Self:SELF.eject
        Eject CD-ROM.

Public

    -Self:SELF.close
        Close CD-ROM drive handling.

Public

    -Self:SELF.cd_numtracks:INTEGER
        Return the number of tracks of the CD-ROM else 0.

Public

    -Self:SELF.cd_cur_track:INTEGER
        Current track position

Public

    -Self:SELF.cd_cur_track_length:INTEGER
        Length, in frames, of the current track

Public

    -Self:SELF.cd_track_length :INTEGER :INTEGER
        Length, in frames, of a given track.

Public

    -Self:SELF.cd_cur_frame:INTEGER
        Current frame offset within current track
